definition: to lease out/to rent (one's property out to sb else)
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: News of the leases leaked out at once.
Businesses that needed to lease space took advantage of the market weakness to extract concessions out of landlords.
sentences.chinese: 有租賃需要的商行利用市場疲軟吸納房東的租讓。
